The patrol's attention is caught by an old animal, one that limps as it grazes. They creep forward on their bellies, tightening the noose around the weakened animal. Survival of the fittest.

Sometimes it's better to let the prey come to you. s_c, with the knowledge of a builder, positions the patrol between the best rabbit feeding grounds and the rabbits' burrows. Then all they have to do is wait.
s_c makes sure that as the sun creeps over the horizon it flashes its light into the eyes of the patrol's prey. The trick wins both prey and purrs from {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates.

fail_outcomes.text: Some days you win some - some days you lose some. It's nobody's fault.

intro_text: As the patrol travels the territory, they come upon a strange metal forest that the Twolegs have built. Smooth, white tree trunks rise up into the sky, completely bare apart from the very top, where three massive branches grow outwards and spin in slow circles. A low hum permeates the air.

This place is unnerving, and the patrol hunts cautiously, keeping an eye out for Twolegs all the while.

fail_outcomes.text: This place is unnerving, and the patrol can't stand the tense atmosphere and grating, constant noise. They don't stay long enough to find prey.

intro_text: This is just one of the weirdest things {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} ever seen, r_c comments to p_l, as the patrol stares at c_n's uninvited guest to their hunting grounds. Are they going to do anything about that... thing?
decline_text: Well, they don't really have time to linger - they'll try another hunting place.

success_outcomes.text: After a good long session of confusion, the patrol manages to work out that the towering creature they're tracking is almost certainly a maned wolf, a nearly mythical creature. They're all a little uncomfortable, watching an oversized red fox with the legs of a deer amble around their territory, but it's also a little thrilling to follow such a rare creature.

The rumors are true - it seems to mostly be hunting for tiny mouse prey, not large things, despite its massive size. This must be a maned wolf, and just being able to name the odd thing makes it feel so much less threatening. The cats remind each other of the tales sometimes shared in the nursery, of how the tallest predator on the plains is also one of the shyest.

s_c recalls some of the stories c_n tells of the maned wolf - of how it stole its legs from a deer for speed and power, but in doing so also accidentally took the deer's flightiness. Ever since then, it has been the tallest and shyest creature on the grasslands.

Boldly, s_c jumps down to go check the potential threat out, and, unwilling to leave their Clanmate in danger, the rest of the patrol follows. s_c refuses to let {PRONOUN/s_c/self} be intimidated by the huge foxish thing, and bounds up to it, knowing courage can overcome things raw strength cannot. The weird creature skitters away from the incoming patrol, trotting off in a tangle of too-long legs.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries - they do - but they can't get a good look at the distorted red foxish creature and eventually have to return to camp to give a rather unsatisfactory report. The cats stalk off to attend to other duties, feeling like they should've been able to do better.
s_c's frayed nerves can't handle this weird monster, and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/beg/begs} to go back home instead of confronting it.

The cats fall into battle, descending onto the maned wolf and battering it, using teamwork to pull at its long legs and fox tail. The wolf turns in skipping circles, yelping, then flees, leaving the triumphant cats with a single mouse for all that effort. Good work, team.

With a sigh, p_l recognizes that having a maned wolf poaching from c_n's hunting grounds will become a problem pretty quickly. {PRONOUN/p_l/poss/CAP} six cat patrol might be the best way to solve the problem before it begins. All the cats, tense and ready, wait to ambush the wolf as it hunts, and drive it out of the territory before it catches any more than a mouse. The stolen mouse is returned to c_n's fresh-kill pile, where it belongs.

While {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}'d hardly expected to need {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} skills on a hunting patrol, s_c sets up an excellent battle plan. It's only halfway through ambushing the beast that the patrol realizes it's a maned wolf, which makes their job infinitely easier. They drive away the timid predator from c_n territory with enough time left over to bring a mouse or two back for the fresh-kill pile before sundown.

With a full patrol, it's possible to take on something the size of a maned wolf, especially when it has the bravery of a deer fawn - but not when s_c attacks with so little forethought and forces the rest of the patrol to save {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} tail. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/retreat/retreats} as the incensed maned wolf snarls, and the rest of the patrol tries not to do the same at s_c.

decline_text: The patrol decides not to quarrel with the fox and to find prey elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol's cats are smaller, but they outnumber the fox, if only by a little, and it's a prize they're willing to fight for. With a prayer to StarClan, they throw themselves into battle, and the fox, already half full and unwilling to lose blood over it, is driven off from the kill.
